result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

as to Jonathan LaVoy with a copy of the DNA Evidence Letter
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Johnson after August 1, 2022.

Defendant Jacob W Andler in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Jacob W Andler. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Resolved. Requesting argued Plea Sentencing. Requesting 60 days- need to be reassigned clerk to email new dates. Minutes filed.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

8:56 AM Case called. Defendant Jacob W Andler in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Jacob W Andler. Atty TenHaken for the state. 
Reading waived. 
Not guilty plea entered, speedy and jury reserved. 
State is in compliance with victims rights. No victims present. 
Status set for June 2, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM (64-06) Defendant Jacob W Andler appeared by video. Attorney Jonathan LaVoy appeared in court for Jacob W. Andler. Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting a couple of weeks for the Arraignment Hearing.
No objection by Attorney LaVoy.

Adj. 2:15 PM
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.G. OR RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob W Andler in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Motion to modify bond by Attorney LaVoy. Argument, granted. State objects to bond modification. Cash posted to be returned. Mintues filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
